topic.title: First [Mini] Release
topic.shortdesc: A quick [technical] intro on my app and why I chose to do what I did. 2024 - 10 - 16 All dates are in the format YYYY MM DD. TLDR: Why I structured my app as so. No GUI as of now.

body.p:
I wanted to do some practice on OOP, making super and child classes.
PlanStructure.java is very empty and works for now just as a bridge between Main.java and the plans. I aim to use this as a sort of glossary or a way to look for plans.
To access and use different plans, they will all be inheriting from Plan.java. I also made the Exercise.java class act as the foundation for exercises. As of this moment, all the lower and specific classes such as Bench, Deadlift, Squat.java, etc. are blank and I will soon implement class-specific attributes such as "areas hit."
Future plans include a GUI that ties in with what I have in the engine folder. I feel confident in my ability to tie it in as well as making new programs as I feel like I have a lot of reusable and understandable code.
I have yet to implement some methods across the board such as:
getAssistanceWorkExercises() in Plan.java implementors
As of now, I aim to just give a list of exercises to choose from though I should implement a quick volume amount (sets and reps and how heavy + more specifics).
my test files; test.java
hopefully a way to match proper weights for the specified week and and day?
